techmeme.title: BCG, McKinsey, KPMG, and other consultants see rising demand for AI advisory services; BCG earns 20% of its revenue from AI-related work vs. 0% two years ago (Tripp Mickle/New York Times)
In a rare admission of ad fraud, Yahoo Japan to waive $189M ad revenue, or ~1.6% of parent company LY Corp's FY 2023 revenue, after detecting fraudulent clicks (Laura Dobberstein/The Register)

Some CIOs say getting full value out of AI tools like Copilot for Microsoft 365 requires heavy lifting, as enterprise data isn't always accurate and up-to-date (Isabelle Bousquette/Wall Street Journal)
Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands, a special envoy to startup accelerator Techleap, says Europe risks falling behind the US and China by over-regulating AI (Ryan Browne/CNBC)
Sources: India's Ministry of Corporate Affairs investigation finds Byju's did not commit financial fraud but had compliance lapses that led to mounting losses (Bloomberg)
